Hello,

we're going to establish unit-testing (basically for web applicatio=
ns)
in our company. Because we don't want to change  the whole programming
=
paradigm to XP we rather want to use a test-last method in the
beginning an=
d then watch out for further steps.
I'm now in the process of investigating=
 the basic requirements and
conditions.
One question that occured is if it'=
s possible to quantify the amount
of extra time you need when using unit te=
sting compared to the
non-testing approach. I solely refer to the writing o=
f unit tests.
Later saving of time (by better code) shouldn't be considered=
. So
what's your experience? Can anybody do a statement about time
consumpt=
ion of writing unit tests?

Regards
Felix
